channel.title: MSDN Just Published
channel.description: Keep current with all the new technical articles, columns, specifications, and resources published on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN).

item.title: Microsoft Office System and XML: Bringing XML to the Desktop
item.description: Discover how the Microsoft Office System brings XML to the desktop through support for custom schemas in Word 2003 and Excel 2003, to FrontPage 2003 as an authoring environment for XML-based sites, and XML as the native file format for InfoPath 2003.

item.title: Avoiding Automatic Refresh
item.description: Automatic page refresh can confuse users with cognitive disabilities when a page reloads without the user?s request. In this article, you'll learn how to apply explicit manual control of page refreshing.

item.title: MSDN TV: Rebuilding MSDN with Angle Brackets, Pt. 1
item.description: Tim Ewald tours MSDN's new XML pipeline, examines how we use schemas, XPath, and XSLT to implement logic declaratively. He concludes with a look at our next steps, including more generic plumbing and exposing XML content through RSS and Web services.

item.title: MSDN TV: Hard Core Messaging with WSE 2.0, Pt. 1
item.description: With Web Services Enhancements 2.0, the Microsoft platform supports RPC-style coding and document oriented messaging. Keith Ballinger outlines several SOAP messaging types and provides an overview of the new messaging infrastructure in WSE 2.0.

item.title: MSDN TV: Hard Core Messaging with WSE 2.0, Pt. 2
item.description: With Web Services Enhancements 2.0, the Microsoft platform supports RPC-style coding and document oriented messaging. Keith Ballinger outlines several SOAP messaging types and provides an overview of the new messaging infrastructure in WSE 2.0.

item.title: Web Services Coordination (WS-Coordination)
item.description: Web Services transaction specification revisions now available.

item.title: Transaction Specification Index Page
item.description: Web Services transaction specification revisions now available.

item.title: MapPoint North America 2004
item.description: Explore Microsoft MapPoint 2004, a powerful, comprehensive solution for integrating maps, demographics, and geographical data into your business solutions and Microsoft Office documents.

item.title: Web Services Atomic Transaction (WS-AtomicTransaction)
item.description: Web Services Transaction specification revisions now available.

item.title: Programming with the Microsoft Office Visio 2003 ActiveX Control
item.description: Learn to integrate the Microsoft Office Visio 2003 ActiveX Control, also referred to as the Visio drawing control, into applications.

item.title: Microsoft InfoPath 2003 Decision Tree: Comparing InfoPath Forms to Other Microsoft Solutions
item.description: Clarify the role that Microsoft Office InfoPath 2003 plays in relation to Microsoft Windows Forms, Web Forms, and Microsoft Office Word 2003 and Microsoft Office Excel 2003 smart documents.

item.title: XSLT Simplify Development and Maintenance of Microsoft .NET Projects with Code Generation Techniques
item.description: Code generation techniques using technologies such as XSLT are playing an increasingly important part in software projects. Learn more about it here.

item.title: DataGrid Tailor Your DataGrid Apps Using Table Style and Custom Column Style Objects
item.description: This article explains the basic operations of the DataGrid and shows how to extend the DataGrid to display columns of data in an application-appropriate manner.

item.title: Tablet PC Achieve the Illusion of Handwriting on Paper When Using the Managed INK API
item.description: Creating the illusion of a pen writing on paper is no easy software task. Fortunately, the .NET Framework hosts Tablet PC extensions

item.title: ASP.NET Jump Start Your Web Site Development with the ASP.NET Starter Kits
item.description: Get real working samples and a good foundation for your ASP.NET Web projects.

item.title: Windows Rights Management Client SDK
item.description: The Microsoft Windows Rights Management client Software Development Kit (SDK) can be used by applications to enforce terms of use for encrypted digital assets, regardless of their format or content.

item.title: Introducing the Windows Media Device Manager SDK
item.description: Get a high-level overview of the target applications that are enabled by the Windows Media Device Manager SDK.

item.title: Working with C#: Building a Lightweight Message-Passing System
item.description: Eric Gunnerson discusses socket-based architecture and how to create an efficient, easy-to use message-passing system that runs on both PCs and Pocket PCs.

item.title: DCOM Interop Generate Custom Managed C++ Wrappers for Easier COM Interoperation Using DCOMSuds
item.description: If you want to use your COM components from managed code, you have to wrap them in a runtime-callable wrapper that acts as a proxy between the component and your managed code.

item.title: Windows Rights Management Services SDK
item.description: Learn how to encrypt, license, and deliver content on the fly, with a license customized for the requesting client, all in a server-based application. This documentation covers two example scenarios for Web projects, the basic knowledge that you will need to build these scenarios, and a detailed examination of the included sample application.

item.title: Web Services Extend the ASP.NET WebMethod Framework with Business Rules Validation
item.description: Here the authors show how to enforce business rules during the deserialization of XML data. The technique uses declarative XPath assertions to test business rule compliance.

item.title: Implementing Drag and Drop in Visual Basic .NET
item.description: Adding drag and drop to your Windows Forms apps is easy. See how drag and drop works and learn how to build features for dragging and dropping text, pictures, files, and list items.

item.title: Creating a Cache Configuration Object for ASP.NET
item.description: Improve reuse of your cached data by encapsulating caching best practices into a helper class. You can manage caching policies across the application and significantly reduce lines of code you'll need.

item.title: Creating Custom Columns for the ASP.NET Datagrid
item.description: Boost the power of the ASP.NET Datagrid control by adding reuseable custom columns, and display your data more effectively.

item.title: Ask Dr. GUI: How to Retrieve the Job Object Using the Process ID or Process Handle
item.description: Dr. GUI shows how to retrieve the Job Object associated with the process ID or the process handle by using the Microsoft Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) APIs.

item.title: MSDN TV: SOAP: Service-Oriented Architecture and Programming, Pt. 2
item.description: Don Box continues his talk on the objective and subjective conjoining of software components and services.

item.title: Chat: Networking in the Windows Server 2003 SDK
item.description: Read the transcript from a recent chat with Windows programmers, testers, and PSDK editors as they answered questions regarding networking with Windows Server 2003.

item.title: WS-Security Drilldown in Web Services Enhancements 2.0
item.description: Use WSE 2.0 to implement security, trust, and secure conversations in Web services architecture. Discover the security-related changes since WSE 1.0.

item.title: Royalty-Free CIFS Technical Reference License Agreement
item.description: See the updated Royalty-Free CIFS Technical Reference License Agreement.

item.title: Enabling HIPAA Data to be Transported over the Internet Using Microsoft .NET Technology
item.description: Learn how to overcome the challenges encountered when implementing Microsoft .NET technologies over the Internet, enabling HIPAA-compliant transactions for existing mainframe systems.

item.title: Smart Access: Access and Word 2003
item.description: Up until now, creating Word documents from Access required extensive knowledge of the Word object model plus some significant programming knowledge. With Word 2003, that's all changed. Read this article to learn how.

item.title: Hardcore Visual Basic: Fun With DrawImage
item.description: Learn how to use the Visual Basic .NET DrawImage method to resize and rotate images much more easily than could be done in Visual Basic 6.0.

item.title: Designing "Sometimes Off-line" Microsoft .NET Compact Framework Applications
item.description: Learn how applications that are "sometimes off-line" can be synchronized with a server by understanding optional designs.

item.title: Add COM and ActiveX Support in .NET Compact Framework Using Odyssey Software CFCOM
item.description: Add COM and ActiveX support to .NET Compact Framework applications in Visual C#. Also, learn how to use the Macromedia Flash Player 6 in .NET Compact Framework applications for Pocket PCs.

item.title: FoxTalk: Prototyping an MS Visio Template UI
item.description: A useful feature of the Microsoft Visio user interface is the way that groups of templates are presented. Predrag Bosnic explores how to mimic this useful and intuitive feature in Visual FoxPro.

item.title: SQL Server Professional: System-Supplied Trace UDFs
item.description: Baya Pavliashvili and Kevin Kline explore a set of SQL Server user-defined functions from Microsoft that are related to traces.

item.title: MSDN Chat Transcript: Debugging with Visual Basic .NET (8/19/03)
item.description: Visual Basic .NET Debugging team members answer questions about tracking variables in the Watch window, debugging Windows services, debugging VSA scripts, and more.

item.title: MSDN Chat Transcript: Networking in the Windows Server 2003 SDK
item.description: Windows experts answer user questions about IPv6, Active Directory security, and more.

item.title: MSDN Chat Transcript: Deploying Visual Basic .NET Applications (8/26/03)
item.description: Visual Studio .NET deployment team members diagnose customer problems with deploying Visual Basic .NET applications, including issues with the .NET Framework, Crystal.NET, MDAC, and more.

item.title: Hardcore Visual Studio: Deploying ASP.NET Applications Built on Different Framework Versions
item.description: In this article from Hardcore Visual Studio .NET, Zhanbo Sun discusses the requirements for side-by-side configuration and development with ASP.NET.

item.title: MSDN TV: SOAP: Service-Oriented Architecture and Programming, Pt. 1
item.description: Don Box waxes poetic on the objective and subjective conjoining of software components and services.

item.title: Creating a Windows Media Services Logging Plug-in
item.description: Create a custom plug-in with the Microsoft Windows Media Services Software Development Kit (SDK), Microsoft Visual Studio .NET, and the C# programming language.

item.title: Building Windows Media Player and Windows Media Encoder Plug-ins
item.description: Learn to create plug-ins that extend the functionality of Microsoft Windows Media Player 9 Series and Windows Media Encoder 9 Series.

item.title: Custom Button Faces in a Managed Code Add-in for the Microsoft Office System
item.description: Learn how to create a resource file and place icon images in it; then learn how to access that content in your code and place its icon images on the faces of custom buttons.

item.title: Listing Button Faces in the Command Bar for Microsoft Office System
item.description: John R. Durant shows how to work with the command bar object model in a managed Office solution, while also making the solution cross-version compatible.

item.title: Super-Easy Guide to the Microsoft Office Excel 2003 Object Model
item.description: Frank Rice shows how easy it is to use the Excel object model to customize the way you work with Excel in lessons that include programming concepts, practice sessions, and real-world examples.

item.title: Adding Windows Media Support with the Windows Media Format 9 Series SDK
item.description: Learn how to add Windows Media support to your applications with the Microsoft Windows Media Format 9 Series Software Development Kit (SDK).

item.title: Announcing Microsoft.com Web Services
item.description: The Microsoft.com Web Service will enable you to integrate information and services from MSDN, Technet, other Microsoft.com sites, and Microsoft Support. Future releases will build on this architecture to provide access to a broader variety of Microsoft content and services.

item.title: MSDN TV: .NET Compact Framework for Next Generation Smartphone Devices
item.description: Interested in .NET Compact Framework for Smartphone? Neil Enns and Ori Amiga present a cool demo of building a weather application in less than five minutes using Visual Studio.NET 2003 and a next generation Smartphone device.

item.title: Manage XML Using .NET Compact Framework
item.description: Through communication and local storage examples, this article shows you how to use and manage Extensible Markup Language (XML) in your Microsoft Windows .NET Compact Framework applications.

item.title: MSDN TV: 64-bit Common Language Runtime and the .NET Framework
item.description: The next release of the .NET Framework includes 32- and 64-bit native support. Christopher Brown discusses how developers writing managed code today will be able to easily port and, often, copy existing applications to this new environment.

item.title: MSDN TV: Identifying and Mitigating Managed Breaking Changes
item.description: Kit George talks about defining a breaking change and then reviews several samples highlighting different kinds of changes that can be considered breaking. Also, he discusses mitigation strategies, including use of the ObsoleteAttribute.

item.title: MSDN Chat Transcript: Windows CE .NET (8/5/03)
item.description: Embedded Devices team members answer Windows CE-related queries about ActiveX, device drivers, C++ support, the Compact Framework, and more.

item.title: MSDN Chat Transcript: Windows XP Embedded Chat: EWF and El Torito
item.description: Members of the Windows Embedded team answer questions about CD-ROM authoring with Enhanced Write Filter (EWF) and El-Torito.

item.title: Developing Connected .NET Pocket PC Applications Using Web Services
item.description: Discover how to get mobile access to the Internet by combining the connectivity of the Pocket PC and the dynamics of XML-based Web Services.

item.title: Weather Web Services on Pocket PC Phone
item.description: The combination of mobility and XML Web services provides exciting possibilities for application development. Read how the author combines weather Web services to add value to the Pocket PC Phone.

item.title: Moving from Visual Basic 6.0 to ASP.NET
item.description: Explore how Visual Basic 6.0 developers can easily move their skills to the Web using ASP.NET. With ASP.NET and Visual Studio .NET, creating Web applications and stand-alone Windows desktop applications are becoming nearly identical tasks.

item.title: Understanding WS-Policy
item.description: WS-Policy provides a general model and syntax for describing and communicating the policies of a Web service. Here's how it works.

item.title: The .NET Show: Managed Code
item.description: In this episode, Brad Abrams and Anders Hejlsberg discuss the architectural issues involved with Managed Code, while Nick Hodapp and Chris Sells show some of the programming benefits.

item.title: Architect Webcast: Architecting Solutions to More Easily Access, Integrate, and Deliver Mainframe-Based Data in the .NET Environment
item.description: This session highlights proven methodologies to easily access host data, building integrated applications on the Microsoft .NET platform, and rapidly deliver the information to users.

item.title: The Mobility and Embedded Developer Center is Here!
item.description: Visit the new one-stop shop for all mobile and embedded information, including the .NET Compact Framework, Visual Studio .NET, Pocket PC, Smartphone, and Windows CE .NET.

item.title: Mobility and Embedded Developer Center Editor's note
item.description: Visit the new one-stop shop for all mobile and embedded development information, including the .NET Compact Framework, Visual Studio .NET, Windows Mobile-based Pocket PC and Smartphone, and Windows CE .NET.

item.title: Coding4Fun: Developing Priorities: Fun First
item.description: Duncan Mackenzie shows how the coolness of a feature can increase its chance of being finished early in a development project, as he creates an application to retrieve and display a RSS feed his way.
